summary: Enhances Skyrim\'s climate to a realistic look. (formerly Ultimate Weather Enhancements)  Endorse is you like!
descriptionHtml:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
[SIZE=5][COLOR=#92d050][B]DESCRIPTION:[/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

Enhances Skyrim\'s climate & weather to a realistic look. It also changes the weather chances in the various regions of Skyrim, as described below.

I was always disappointed at how dark & colorless the weather was in Skyrim, AND in all of the weather mods. I understand that it\'s supposed to be cold & atmospheric, but that doesn\'t mean you need to make it extremely dark & gloomy; in my opinion. So I modified the weather myself; making the main-end-goal realism. It turns-out to be a very attractive weather modification, while not going overboard on looks. The weather features some depth of field outside, strength depending on the weather. A lot of the precipitation-weather has fog that fades into the sky just as in real life!, a very unique feature of this mod.


[I]General description of weather chances:[/I]
-More cloudy weather types/precipitation down south & in/around mountains. More sun in the northern regions than in the mountains & the south. The Throat of the World is usually foggy or blizzard, with a smaller chance of being clear (The TOTW has it\'s own sunny weather which resembles the World Map).
I based the weather chances off of the climates of Norway/Subarctic areas.

[IMG]http://www.ecardmax.com/hoteditor/upload/2k41550fa689.jpg[/IMG] 

......................................................................................................................................
[SIZE=3][B][COLOR=#92d050][I]IMPORTANT NOTES:[/I][/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

-Most of the screenshots are from the 1.3 version! I haven\'t had time to update them.

-My screenshots do not include other lighting mods, nor do they include FXAA. They also have low graphics options enabled. (my computer sucks, haha)

-It doesn\'t lower performance whatsoever.

-I am currently working on a new version that may be out soon.

......................................................................................................................................
[SIZE=3][B][COLOR=#92d050][I]COMPATIBILITY:[/I][/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

-It\'s not compatible with mods that change the weather or climate. (texture replacements ARE compatible) (ENB should be compatible)

-It IS compatible with Dawngaurd.

-It will soon be compatible with Dragonborn.

......................................................................................................................................
[B][COLOR=#92d050][I]INSTALLATION:[/I][/B][/COLOR]

-Simply extract the downloaded file, then drop it into your Skyrim/Data folder, easy no-fuss installation!

......................................................................................................................................
[SIZE=2][B][COLOR=#92d050][I]OTHER WEATHER-RELATED MODS THAT GO WELL WITH SKYRIM REALISTIC WEATHER MOD:[/I][/B][/COLOR][/SIZE]

[B]Wet and Cold:[/B] (adds a cold-breath effect on characters in cold weather & also a wet-look when they get wet!)
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/27563

[B]Frostfall:[/B] (adds a good hypothermia system into the game so that you have to keep warm!)
http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/11163/?

......................................................................................................................................
[B][COLOR=#92d050][FONT=Book Antiqua][I]MY FALLOUT 3 WEATHER MOD:[/I][/FONT][/B][/COLOR]

Check out my Fallout 3 weather mod: http://fallout3.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=17006

[IMG]http://www.ecardmax.com/hoteditor/upload/2kc0ae8a1c3f.jpg[/IMG]
